Compression Support: 1. Compression Support: AIFC files can store audio data in a compressed format, allowing for reduced file sizes compared to standard AIFF files.
Multi-Channel Audio: 2. Multi-Channel Audio: AIFC files can support multiple channels, enabling stereo and surround sound configurations.
High-Quality Audio: 3. High-Quality Audio: Despite being compressed, AIFC files can maintain high audio quality, supporting various bit depths and sample rates.
Looping and Markers: 4. Looping and Markers: AIFC files can include loop points and markers, which are useful for audio editing and playback control.
Metadata Support: 5. Metadata Support: AIFC files can contain metadata such as track titles, artist information, and other descriptive data.
Compatibility: 6. Compatibility: AIFC files are compatible with various audio editing and playback software, especially on macOS systems.
Extensible Format: 7. Extensible Format: AIFC files can be extended to support additional features or custom chunks, allowing for future enhancements and flexibility in storing audio data.
Non-Destructive Editing: 8. Non-Destructive Editing: Some AIFC files support non-destructive editing, where changes can be made without altering the original audio data.
